A July 2018 report found that 45: 8 percent of children in California live at or near poverty, supporting the claim made by Gavin Newsom.
The California Poverty Measure: a joint research effort by the Public Policy Institute of California and the Stanford Center on Poverty and Inequality, was used to closely examine poverty in the state and verify the claim.
The report takes into account California: s high cost-of-living and factors that offset those costs, such as the state's social safety net programs, in determining the poverty rate.
